result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:02 AM Defendant CARLTON O SCHLEY SR in court.  Attorney John H. Bradley in court for CARLTON O SCHLEY SR.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Bradley acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Court goes over penalties. Atty Bradley enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 11:02 AM.

Court will set for Return Date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 AM.
Return date scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Return date on January 17, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Transcript:  September 21, 2022 Adjourned Preliminary Hearing
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection

1:09 PM Defendant CARLTON O SCHLEY SR in court.  Attorney John H. Bradley in court for CARLTON O SCHLEY SR.  Attorney Randal Richard Resch in court for CARLTON O SCHLEY SR.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Assistant Attorney General Emily Thompson for the State of Wisconsin. 

Trooper Tracy Drager sworn. Statement by Atty Bradley regarding witness appearing via zoom. Statement by DA Laspisa. Statement by the Court. Cross examination by Atty Bradley. Testimony given. Objection by Atty Thompson. Overruled. Atty Bradley continues with cross examination. Statement by Atty Thompson. Statement by the Court. Atty Bradley continues with cross examination. Argument by DA Laspisa. Statement by the Court - any objection is overruled. Atty Bradley continues. Court questions witness. Statement by Atty Bradley, will accept this time. Atty Bradley continues with cross examination. Off the record at 1:24 PM. Back on the record at 1:24 PM. Cross examination continues. DA Laspisa objects. Overruled. DA Laspisa objects. Overruled. DA Laspisa objects. Overruled. DA Laspisa objects. Overruled. Atty Thompson objects. Sustained. Re-direct examination by Atty Thompson. Re-cross by Atty Bradley. No re-direct. 

Zachary Bingen sworn, direct by Atty Bradley, is employed as a consulting engineer. Goes over training. Argument by Atty Thompson. Court makes statement. Statement by Atty Bradley. Argument by DA Laspisa. Court makes statement.  Argument by Atty Bradley. Court questions witness. Statement by witness. Court makes statement to Atty Bradley. Argument by Atty Bradley. Argument by Atty Thompson. Atty Bradley continues with direct examination. Cross examination by Atty Thompson. Re-direct by Atty Bradley. 

Trooper Tracy Drager re-called and still under oath. Cross examination by Atty Bradley. Atty Thompson objects. Sustained. Court questions witness. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Court adjourned at 2:26 PM

Court will set for Arraignment on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

8:39 AM Defendant CARLTON O SCHLEY SR in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Emily Thompson of Department of Justice present in court. Attorney John H. Bradley in court for CARLTON O SCHLEY SR.  Attorney Randal Richard Resch in court for CARLTON O SCHLEY SR. Statement by Atty Bradley re: subpoena for documents that one of the witnesses was to bring. Statement by DA Laspisa. Statement by Atty Johnson. Statement by the Court. Statement by Atty Thompson. Statement by DA Laspisa. Statement by Atty Bradley. Statement by the court, will have the witness called. Atty Johnson objects to the witness taking the stand. Overruled.

Trooper Tracy Drager sworn, direct by Atty Thompson, is employed by WI State Patrol as a Crash Reconstruction Trooper. Goes over the date in question. Testimony given. Identified the defendant present in court. Court makes statement to Atty Bradley, will determine if they are entitled to the documents or not. Statement by Atty Bradley - have no questions for the witness. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant. Court gives counsel 30 days to submit briefs. Review in 30 days.

Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
